website_summaries.verdict: If all you need or want is to point and shoot, the Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS does that well.
cons: Basic feature set for its price

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Seller
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 9 year old grandson for his birthday for an upcoming trip to Yosemite National Park. He really enjoyed taking his own photos throughout the trip and gave him a sense of pride. The camera worked well, was easy for him to operate and took a decent shots. What we were so thankful for was the sellers prompt delivery of the camera. It came way before the expected and with a personal note. Great seller, prompt service. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: ChristineH

customer_reviews.title: Good Old-school camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these over the years. They are fairly easy to use, take good pictures and videos and I like the use of a SD card rather than plugging into a my laptop which is dependent on the current version of software that I may be running. I have dropped one on these when the lens was extended, I managed to damage the lens retract mechanism and the camera gave me an error message. The cost to repair far exceeded the replacement cost. Found one used here on Amazon for a great price. I purchased an extra battery and larger SD capacity cards. You can take more pics than your phone will hold and videos as well.
customer_reviews.author: Phil H.

customer_reviews.title: The thing I love about this is that it just works
customer_reviews.text: The thing I love about this is that it just works. Find some settings you like and whenever you need it, it comes through. The picture quality is great. The stability feature works. The video works great as well. Loading pictures to your PC is simple. The battery lasts a long time and recharging is easy. Everything about this camera in terms of basic use is good. Admittedly, I have never gotten heavy into the elaborate possibilities of all the settings. There are a lot. And I am sure there are much better camera options out there now. But at this price, this thing is a great deal. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Rasalin

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE this little camera
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this little camera! The pictures are crisp and high quality, the system is easy to navigate, and all functions are convenient and clear. The recording file is in .avi rather than .mov, which I appreciate as the video editing software I own is older. I have filmed countless edited and compiled videos with this type of camera and am always pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a refurb: Not meant to be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for work. Didn't want to use my phone camera to snap pictures. Cheap and a refurb. Takes the pictures. The flaws I found out of the box: 1. Charger is not a Canon charger. 2. Camera is scratched and beat up badly 3. The sensor that is to be used for video mode is damaged. Need to confirm if this will impact picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I miss the old automatic cameras of years ago - no multitude of adjustments required, just point and shoot. The only thing I like about this camera is the ability to download pictures to my computer and forward them by email. I really don't like this camera; every time I go to use it I have to relearn all the features again so I can work myself thru it. And in the end, the pictures are not as sharp as I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Proud to Speak English

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Canon Fan
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd digital camera, first one wore out. I read and read reviews on several cameras in this category and this price range then narrowed it down to 2, Canon Powershot SD1300IS and the Nikon Coolpix S3000. Decided on the Canon, very happy with my camera, still learning all that it can do. Liked that it came with a free picture card, also glad that I don't have to buy anymore batteries, the charger with the battery is great. Glad the av cable came with the camera as well, Nikon did not offer that with the S3000. Will do an update after I take more pictures and learn more things about this nifty little camera.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mathes

customer_reviews.title: A good, basic, ultracompact camera; very good value
customer_reviews.text: This camera, now available at not much over the $100 price point, is about as good a digital camera as one could possibly get for this amount of money. It is not a substitute for a higher end camera by any means, but at this price, it is well worth it if you need a basic point-and-shoot digital that's reliable and extremely compact. After all, what good is the mid-range or top-range camera that you haven't got with you when you need it??? This camera is very compact, can easily fit in a pocket, and is light. What makes this camera a winner is the overall combination of portability, ease of use, and good image quality.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously owned the Canon SD 750, which I had for three years. I used it all of the time, and had wonderful results. Unfortunately, that camera was stolen from our room during a recent Econolodge hotel stay. Since I loved my old camera, I checked out all of the newer Canons. After comparing this camera with other Canons, and all of the Nikon Coolpix, and reading reviews for all of them, I chose to purchase this camera. I love it! It has many more features than my previous Canon, and takes great pictures. It's so small that I can easily slip it into my purse. A great camera, at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: N. Victor

customer_reviews.title: Works well. It's not perfect, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: It's a point and shoot, so don't expect DSLR quality out of this camera. It works well enough for the price and the size, and it came in a pretty pastel blue color. That's all I ask for. The pictures come out a bit white and filmy so I always have to raise the contrast after loading them into my phone. Other than that it's not a big issue. Picasa can easily fix it most of the time. Maybe there's a white balance setting on the camera that I messed up on, but I haven't found it yet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Great simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Took back the Sony DSC-370W that I bought for my wife as it had the worst shutter response of any point-and-shoot I have used and replaced it with this camera. The response time is much better even with the face recognition turned on. Easy to use switching from Auto to Program to video modes. Inside images are still a touch fuzzy but outdoor shots are quick and sharp. I would recommend this camera for anyone looking for basic snapshot pictures in an easy to use point and shoot (oh yeah and my wife doesn't care too much about the rest of the stuff - she's just happy its pink!)
customer_reviews.author: SC-techie

customer_reviews.title: Was ok but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Received about four months ago, was working good even though was not to happy with the picture quality especially indoors as I've always been a Canon fan up to now. I still have an eleven year old Mini DV camera that works flawlessly however seems that their newer products are garbage. The camera recently stopped working completely! Thought maybe it was the battery had gone bad, tried putting in a new battery and still nothing. The thing won't turn on at all. Canon customer service was no help at all so pretty much it's going out in the trash tomorrow. Thanks Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: This was the third or fourth Powershot camera we purchased, and we enjoy the design and ease of use. The picture quality was good but not stellar, and transferring photo's to the computer was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: We purchsed this camera for a trip to Buenos Aires. We wanted something small to fit in a pocket that would also take close up and panoramic pictures. I was worried that this camera did not have optical viewfinder but the LCD works great even in bright sunlight. The camera takes great pictures any time of day or night and close up or panoramic. No bluriness due to motion. Powers up quickly and battery holds a charge for an incredibly long time - even when using flash. We really like this camera. I would recommend to anyone who has a need similar to ours.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I woke from a deep slumber to the sound of something crashing onto my pourch. It was in a box larger than my head, but inside was a delicate camera smaller than my hand. I panicked that it could be broken because there was so packaging material whatsoever. No original box. Nothing. Which also includes no instruction book and no MEMORY CARD. For the price I paid, so NOT WORTH IT. I could have found a better deal and camera at a garage sale. Not sure if the camera even works yet because the battery is dead, but there are dents and scratches on the camera itself.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Overby

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: This camera is an OK point-and-shoot, but I've definitely had better. It often has trouble focusing, and the shutter speed is very slow. For example, taking a picture in a bar takes 20+ seconds, which makes for awkward standing-together-when-is-the-flash-going-to-go-off pictures. A lot of my pictures turn out blurry, so there must be something out of whack with the auto focus. Pros: Connects nicely and quickly to my computer Nice screen for viewing Easy to turn off flash Cons: Takes blurry pictures / has trouble focusing Long shutter speeds Flash can totally white out details and faces Lots of red eyes I would definitely shop around before considering this model.
customer_reviews.author: vb

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I did some research before purchasing this camera. Amazon had the best price on the internet and Amazon has been GREAT to deal with- as I returned the camera. The camera was sleek and simple enough to use for basic picture taking. However, as the mother of a one year old, I need a camera that captures pictures of action. (What one year old sits still for longer than 2 seconds?) I could not capture clear pictures when my son was the move. My husband felt that the zoom feature was slow also. Going back to another Kodak model.
customer_reviews.author: SAThompson

customer_reviews.title: Canon is always good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a replacement for a former Canon point and shoot. I would have bought the same camera again, but it has been made obsolete by production needs. This camera frankly is not as good as the one it is replacing; it has fewer features. While it is smaller and more compact, it does not have the range of options for exposures nor does it have the ease of use as the previous generation. The price was right and the features could be better. Nevertheless, it has the predictable canon quality.
customer_reviews.author: K Fitzgibbons

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: We (wife and I) had an ealier version of this camera that we used when we did not want to bring along the digital SLR. However, my 2 boys decided to break that camera against the nice hard sidewalk. It was a no brainer getting another powershot. Keep in mind that this camera is used mostly as a point and shoot quick grab camera so I have not gotten into any of the advanced features. That said, it takes a great picture, is compact and has done exactally what we expected it to do. My one complaint is that it did not use the same batteries as the older camera.
customer_reviews.author: rlt7272

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a geek, and people frequently ask my opinion on electronics. Whenever they want a point and shoot camera, it's always the Canon SD's that I recommend - I have several friends that own them, all are pleased with their purchases. I just bought this one for my brother. With 3 kids he needed something small that would power up quickly to take a nice picture. He especially loves the video mode on it. They have so many new features on them I'm almost wishing my old camera would die so I could get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot, case recommendation
customer_reviews.text: Im not going to review the merits of this point and shoot camera. Other reviews pretty much echo the pros and cons. We find it a great portable point and shoot camera. The "wide angle" aspect really makes pictures look like they are encompassing more area compared to my previous cameras. I would recommend that users looking for a small sleek and fitting case get the Caselogic UNZT-2. We got it and fits wonders. Check out my review on that product for more details.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a small point and shoot but lens got stuck after about 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: ...bought this for when I moved out of the country for a year. The price was good for something that was supposed to tide me over while abroad. It worked, until it stopped working... The lens stopped protruding when the camera was turned on. I do not believe it was anything I did, as I did not drop it or toss it around. I kept it in a camera case. I know it must have been an uncommon defect or event, but I was very disappointed - and cameraless.
customer_reviews.author: fl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon point and shoot camera and I've loved them all. I've only replaced the old one because of new features and so much use. I have been very happy with the SD1300. From my last elph they changed some of the buttons, which I was concerned about. But after a few months of use I think the new configuration is better. The auto feature works great for 90% of pictures and then it is easy to change to what setting you need. Canon camera's are hardy, take great point and shoot photos and are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stine

customer_reviews.title: Easy camera for beginners that works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera based on the amazons best rated digital camera, which price point was around $100. I needed a digital camera for work, which could be easily be used my some non-digital camera savvy employees. To this end, the camera works well and is more than sufficient for point-and-shoot applications (in my case, manufacturing product images). Not a lot of bells and whistles on this camera, but she does the simple job well. I would buy this again for the environment I've placed it in.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great for the casual photographer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little camera for taking fantastic photos. Photo quality is superior to competitor point-and-shoot cameras my friends use. Small enough that it fits in my jeans pocket. As a result, I carry it everywhere! I've been using it for several years now without a single issue. It's intuitive and easy to figure out all the features. In fact, I have yet to open the instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Glad i got it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new camera to replace my old Cannon and I'm pleased to have chosen this one. It is really easy to use for the basic features, but I'll need the manual to understand all of the camera's capabilities. It is great for day to day use, the zoom is fantastic and it is so small I now carry it everywhere with me. I found the images on the screen to be a little yellowish, but since I haven't printed any of them yet, I don't know if they'll turn out the same. Overall, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia S

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My parents got me this camera for Christmas after my SD1100 being stolen on vacation. I love it so far!!! It's so compact and cute. It is perfect for my needs. I am very interested in photography, but don't know a lot about it at this point. I am kind of using this as a learner camera before moving up to bigger and better Canons. I had Kodaks before my SD1100 and they were horrible!! I never had a problem out of my SD1100. I am looking forward to getting some real use out of the SD1300! So far I have only taken a few photos this morning, but all have came out to my liking! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gore

customer_reviews.title: Solid Choice
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the Cannon SD1300IS after using it over the Christmas vacation. I took more than 30 pics and even had a few complete strangers take a few for us. None of them came out poorly and they all had vivid color and clarity. For $109 bucks, this is a real steal of a purchase. Amazon even hooked me up with a credit after the price came down shortly after I purchased mine for ~ $21 more a few days prior. By this and you won't be disappointed in the least!
customer_reviews.author: BJD from ATL

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, but slow on the take
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera when our old Canon Elph died. We had that camera 5 years and LOVED it. We have 2 children and it never missed a shot. So, we decided to upgrade our model to get this camera and we are disappointed in the clarity. It is not as quick to take the shot and many of the shots come out blurry. we never had this issue with our old camera. It is a good camera if you are not looking to take action shots, like fast moving children. Plus, it doesn't seem to have all the same features, like a snow setting. We will stick with it for now but not too happy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: Had thought I lost my previous model of same camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Had thought I lost my previous model of same camera. Ordered this one and 4 mos later I found the other. Now, I have two of them and when we travel my husband is not 'borrowing' my camera. He has his own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and cheap camera
customer_reviews.text: Great for everything. I'm a Nikon DSLR fan. I have all my stuff form this brand, but when I want to purchase a point and shoot camera always choose a Canon one. You get a low price camera with great caracteristics. I found some indoors pics with a blur, but I can think that was my fault and not the camera. Easy camera software. Easy to setup. Good batery life Very well manufactured Great macro I like it so much
customer_reviews.author: Martano

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great for what its worth
customer_reviews.text: this was my first camera, i have a canon rebel now, but this little pocket sized camera was super great, i dropped it a ton and it still worked fine, it takes SUPER good close up images and its quick and easy, great for teenagers. i gave this to my 6 year old cousin and even he could figure it out. it has a self timer and flash. great lil camera
customer_reviews.author: Holly P

customer_reviews.title: black spots
customer_reviews.text: We have had this camera for 2 1/2 years now and the flash has somehow created black spots in the center of every picture I take. I know it is the flash b/c when you push the button half way down and the red light goes on the dots are shown in red on my screen. Loved it till then. Need to call Canon and complain. I have always used Canon and this is the first problem I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: pdlm

customer_reviews.title: a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: This thing died on me 2 months later. It's not the battery. I never dropped it, and it was new in original wrapped package. There was all kind of of electronic glitches and failure in function controls. Sucks that I wasted my money on this. Very unusual though since Canon makes really good cameras.
customer_reviews.author: betterlifetechnology

customer_reviews.title: I never got it.
customer_reviews.text: The supplier refunded my money because they were unable to deliver the camera due to some unexplained shipping problem. I was purchasing this one as a gift for my son. I actually already have this camera and love it. It is small for my ultralight backpacking and takes fabulous pictures. It would have been nice to also get one for my son at the price advertized, but it didn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: Island Boy

customer_reviews.title: Decent Camera... but lens is a problem
customer_reviews.text: We ended up with two of these cameras - one as a gift and the one we purchased on Amazon. Almost a year later the purchased here has a common problem where the lens wont pop out when powered on. After a bit of research on the web it seems this problem is not so uncommon. The camera takes decent pictures. I just the durability of the camera should be better. I'll look for another product next time around.
customer_reviews.author: QuickReviewBuyer

customer_reviews.title: good for distance, NOT for close up nature photos
customer_reviews.text: i bought this camera as a back up to my canon SD100 that takes amazing macro photos but is no longer affordable .. the SD 1300 was offered at a great price .. it does NOT meet my needs . Tho it takes great long distance, wide angle photos, the macro feature produces blurry photos .. no detail ... great in a pinch when yhu want to have a camera but not hapy with the wuality of most of the photos i have taken .
customer_reviews.author: magoo55

customer_reviews.title: Really good and handy
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a small camera with good features and need to be able to handle very Easily. This is the one to buy. it is small and easy to carry and handle very well when I need to take a quick photo. It done has a problem when taking pics of faraway things. But that is not the reason you're getting this, this is a good one to take close pics, quickly. Like I said. it all depends on what you need to do this the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mindika Dharmabandu

customer_reviews.title: Great on the Trail
customer_reviews.text: Customer's wife reviewing - My husband bought this for me to use on the snowmobile trail. The camera is small enough to keep in my Carhartt bib pocket where it stays close to my body. This keeps the battery warm and viable. Have some excellent shots on the trail and have since used it in many settings from picnics to boating excursions to Engineer's Day at the Soo locks. Good product; easy to use; great back-up camera to my Canon digital SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie2l8

customer_reviews.title: A Very good camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give my wife a camera that would take quality pictures and, yet, do the occasional movie of the grand kids. This camera does all of that very well. The optics are very good for the price. One of the aspects of a camera like this is when you playback sound using the camera, it is less than meager. However, when you play it back from a computer or playback device, it is quite good. Also, you need to try different automatic camera settings to get the one that works best for you. For example, setting the ISO to 200 is a good move for us. Would recommend this camera for anyone to use.
customer_reviews.author: David Zalkovsky

customer_reviews.title: Getting Lens Error
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my dream camera. I have always used Canon cameras. I still have SD750 working exceptionally well. I love Canon's picture quality and simple navigations. I got SD1300 and presented to my brother. However within first 8 months i first got lens error. Got it fixed and got the same error after next 2 months.Got it fixed again and it got the same error after 2 weeks. Have never used since. Canon has dissaponted its customers and fans in the recent times. This is a good camera if it works or you are lucky. You will regret buying this Camera if you get Lens/System Error.
customer_reviews.author: Prasad Nagaraja

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed compared to my SD450, a poor upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor upgrade to my Canon Powershot SD450, the pictures are not nearly as good and have had issues with 2 battery packs now. Both OEM Canon, not cheap Chinese copies. Especially poor in low light conditions despite it having 1600 ISO and my SD450 only having 400!! This was a major selling point to me a faster ISO speed!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly parents, who love it. It's compact, but easy to use, will shoot video, and has good battery life and very sharp pictures. Easier to deal with on vacations or visiting grandchildren than bulky film cameras, and easy to share pictures. Retirement today is all about email, and this makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Motley

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the camera for my first trip to Hawaii. I also own a very expensive large camera, but didn't want to risk taking it on this trip. I still use this almost every week, because it fits in my purse and is always handy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Great camera...but it's aqua blue, not green!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera after my Canon Powershot SD1200IS went through the washer and dryer (the battery and SD card still worked though!). I love my new SD1300IS, and it looks and works pretty much identically to 1200IS but with a higher MP and zoom. My only comment is that the new "green" is aqua blue instead of last year's light leaf green - if color matters to you. Overall, it's a perfect small point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: Hook's Hollands

customer_reviews.title: Great little digital camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is extremely easy to use and produces great pictures under all conditions. Excellent choice for those who don't wish to invest a lot of time in learning intricacies of digital cameras. We use it for routine picture taking indoors and outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: snoshow

customer_reviews.title: finally, i found another worthy camera
customer_reviews.text: man am i glad that i found this camera. i've been thru a few others trying to find one that would replace my old sd canon model, but i've been unhappy in all others i've tried. this one takes the cake. it has fast shot-to-shot times, takes excellent pics and is tiny! all the canon's i've had take good pics, but the biggest thing to me (with small kids) was the shot-to-shot times and this one works very well and i am very satisfied with it. and only $150 it is a great bargain as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Our last Canon PowerShot SD1300 finally broke after accidently being dropped for the umpteenth time. It was an amazing camera so we bought another one like the first. We're still totally happy with Canon products and would recommend them over all other camera manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Canon Powershot after my previous model Canon Powershot was stolen. After doing much research on the internet for a new camera to purchase, I ended right back at the Canon Powershot. The reviews were great, it was highly ranked, & as a previous owner I figured I couldn't go wrong. I love the quality of pictures this camera takes, especially the options available. I am very satisfied with my purchase and would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyL

customer_reviews.title: Really good camera!
customer_reviews.text: It takes great photos, and has a lot of personalization options. There are good photo settings, that allow more vibrant colors. The screen is great. There is zooming on video, which I love! There are only a few negative aspects: the sound playback for videos is quite low! Also, the focus can sometimes be blurry, so you always have to make sure it's in focus before taking a photo. The pictures on the camera tend to be much better looking than on the computer :P Might just be my computer though... lol. The keys are kinda flimsy, but I don't see them breaking anytime soon. Overall it was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: cannon powershot minus memory stick
customer_reviews.text: I currently own a Cannon Powershot from 5 years ago and am still very pleased with it. So much so that I purchased this one for my daughter. Strangely enough, it does not come with a memory stick. My experience with digital cameras has been that a memory stick is always included; even a minimal one. So if you buy this camera, don't forget to buy the memory stick to go with it. Or go to Costco like I did so I wouldn't have to wait for delivery in 10 DAYS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: alleycat

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD1300IS
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a very sturdy digital POS camera built to the same standards that I've become accustomed to with Canon products. This is our fifth overall Canon digital camera and second POS and I've noticed no drop off in quality. Excellent camera and I would recommend it to those who require a compact digital camera but who seek comparable digital photographs with the high end Canon EOS line.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin808

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did a little research online hoping to find a point and shoot camera that truly is "point n shoot". This is it. I recently took it on vacation and got beautiful pictures without having to fiddle around with the options. There is a mode that allows you to customize a shot but the Auto function has worked just fine.. I recommend this camera to anyone who is not a camera "pro" but just wants to be able to take great pictures without effort.
customer_reviews.author: TerraNova

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Charged the battery until Green light came on. Bought a new SDHC card. Inserted bought into the camera. Pressed ON. Nothing. Tried pressing the ON button again. Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my camera
customer_reviews.text: My camera stopped working abruptly and I couldn't figure out why. This is the exact same camera, refurbished and other than a few scratches, is just like mine and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaJay

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had another one of these cameras before. It got broken and was beyond repair. Unfortunately best buy didn't have another, so I bought a new one from amazon. I like this camera so much that I bought a new one. It's a really easy to use point and shoot and we even have the underwater case for it, which also works great. It was worth buying a new one to replace my broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a point and shoot camera that takes quality pictures. I've had a Kodak Easy Share and a Nikon Coolpix; neither of them have come close to this Canon. This past weekend is the first time since buying this camera that I've had the opportunity to use it and I wasn't disappointed at all. The small size is very convenient for carrying in my purse. I also bought a carrying case to protect it from scratches. The price was another plus. I recommend this camera to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement camera
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera used to replace an identical one previously purchased but had been dropped. This camera came just as described and works great. We were very pleased with the price and the timely delivery.
customer_reviews.author: S. Magill

customer_reviews.title: excellent pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I have an old G3 and it takes beautiful pictures but it is huge, heavy and slow. This little camera takes great photos and fits in my pocket. I took it to DC and it was perfect save for the shutter freezing a few times (condensation from inside my coat+ 20f temps and the battery meter fluctuating in the freezing temps.It really is a great camera and the price made it a steal!
customer_reviews.author: mezcalfud

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really love this little camera. It fits into my shirt pocket while I am out and about and takes great pictures. My only complaint would be that the auto focus does not work while zooming in the video mode. Other than that, a really good small inexpensive camera. Easy to use and, as mentioned, takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Fordham

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesistent on purchasing the pink Cannon powershot because there are so many different shades of pink. When I got it (which was very quick) it completely matched the color in the picture! A frosting color pink. I am a faithful Cannon powershot camera buyer and I knew this one would be just as good as my others. And it is. Takes great pictures, near and far! A very nice size screen to view pictures and very clear! If you are thinking about getting this camera....do it! You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: AMAZNshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Gave the camera for a gift - I have three similar Canon cameras and love all of them - this model it great because of the ease of getting outstanding quality pictures with low level light - or just plain Bad Light. Great product, fast shipping and great packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Stacey

customer_reviews.title: great pictures  but now has problems
customer_reviews.text: I gave this camera to my daughter for a gradaution gift. She had it for one week and the pictures were excellent. She now has developed a problem with an S shaped image on the pictures that gets larger when you zoom. it is not on the lens so we have had to send the camera back to canon. Have not got the camera back from them yet so do not know wha t the problem is. I am sure it will be fixed but frustratin g that only one week in we developed a problem
customer_reviews.author: A. Tosky

customer_reviews.title: Another good Canon point & shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Canon SD11XX camera. It replaced an SD1100 IS which was unfortunately dropped and my wife has an SD1200 IS. I opted for the SD1300 rather than going for the newer model because these cameras take great photos and videos. The anti shake software is absolutely terrific and the video is as good as it gets from a point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: NH8511

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Color
customer_reviews.text: As a professional photographer and a die hard Canon user/supporter, I have to say this camera is extremely disappointing. I purchased one for my wife, one for my mother and one for my cousin and all three of them have never taken good photos. The color and white balance settings make all indoor pictures look terrible. Camera's sit in the drawer, our cell phones take better pics.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses this camera for everything! She loves the look of it, the color, and the features. What I can say is I am amazed at the quality of her photos when she posts them online. They are crystal clear and beautiful. Expensive camera quality in a small inexpensive Canon. I'm very glad I made this purchase. GREAT camera!
customer_reviews.author: Suzee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Considering it's size, this camera comes well equipped with your P&S " point and shoot " needs. Has great IS ( image stabilizing ) and although it's just a point and shoot, it shoots well under low light. Now this doesn't mean you can shoot in an alley way with just a lamp-post on and get a SHARP image. I recommend this camera to anyone looking to capture moments and not have to carry the BULK of a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: El Jefe.....

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I'm taking pictures and they look like professional shots! The clarity is unbelievable. I love the focusing feature. If you are just looking for a point and shoot camera then let this be your baby! You will find yourself taking pictures of everything because its so easy and they come out beautifully!.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted-to-books

customer_reviews.title: The Len was stuck outside and cannot get back in after 6 months of usage
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this camera in last December. The quality, as a product from canon, really let me down. The camera len got stuck outside and cannot get back in while I was adjusting the focus several weeks ago. Now the camera as a dead one lying on the desk in my dorm. Going to return this item, either for fixing the len issue, or getting reimburse.
customer_reviews.author: HW4318

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend because I like the one I have so much. My boyfriend uses it all the time and says it's easy to use and takes great pictures. His 9 year old daughter enjoys using the camera to take videos. My sister has bought three cameras this same Canon model: one for herself, then she lost it the same day, so she bought another one. She also bought her daughter one for her birthday. So here are many happy customers!
customer_reviews.author: ISFfan

customer_reviews.title: Giving up on Canon PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Canon PowerShot. But I'm done. From what we have observed, the photo quality has declined in the last 2 PowerShots with the 1300IS being the worst. This camera cannot seem to recognize different light sources and many photos are completely washed out. This one in particular has a very bad design flaw. The power button is not recessed, therefore it constantly turns on when it's in my pocket or my wife's purse. Our lens finally got jammed to the point of no longer being able to use it. I've owned nothing but Canon cameras for 15 years now, but it's time for a change.
customer_reviews.author: wspsatisfed

customer_reviews.title: Canon crazed fan
customer_reviews.text: Perfect conditioned camera that takes amazing pictures. For being used, the camera came in pristine condition and takes flawless pictures. This is my second Canon camera after being a Sony buyer and I'll never go back to Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mahler

customer_reviews.title: Great digital camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st digital camera. Amazon was great at providing the info I needed to make a choice. Once I selected this model I did shop on other sites. I saved $40 on the package of camera, memory card, camera case & free shipping. The camera was also on sale for $30 less. Thank You Amazon!!!! It takes fantastic photos even close up. I love the big LED screen.
customer_reviews.author: Teri J Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Nice point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd digital ELPH. Great pocket camera. If you want nice photos and videos in a compact point and shoot camera, this is it. Works best for outdoor shots and als takes nice night shots. Not so great for action but it is a much better camera than the smartphones.
customer_reviews.author: abejo

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot = Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I needed a basic point and shoot. This camera isn't anything too special but for the price it takes good pictures and served it's purpose. If I was looking for another point and shoot I'd probably buy another Canon. It's been almost 2 years now and still works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: StlAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Easy to Use Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a regular guy that wants an easy to use camera that takes high quality pictures and this camera gets the job done. If you just leave it in "automatic" mode all you have to do is point and shoot, and you'll get very nice high quality pictures. It also has an easy to use menu system if you want to get into it and make adjustments and refinements. I also like the form factor - not too big, not too small, fits in a pocket, and feels good in your hands. This is a great camera for a regular person that just wants good pictures without all the fuss.....
customer_reviews.author: AFL

customer_reviews.title: Love it, still use it occasionally
customer_reviews.text: That was a really good camera puchase for me 6 years ago. I use my phone now, but we keep this one around as back up, especially on trips
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact camera with zoom and video
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact camera with zoom and video. Easy to download pictures onto computer, organize pictures on camera, etc. Has many more features than I use.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Goldenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to replace an HP Photosmart r742 that I gave to my mother. I really like this camera. I'm not an expert at all the features this camera has, but so far, all the pictures I've taken have been beautiful. This camera is easy to use and I've had nothing but success so far. I love it. No problems here.
customer_reviews.author: 4evahazeleyez

customer_reviews.title: It is great & replaces a camera that I had accidently damaged
customer_reviews.text: It is great & replaces a camera that I had accidently damaged. My original camera had been given to be by my sister,who died suddenly of cancer,so I had tried to get it repaired & no one would do it. So someone had suggested I try Amazon (for the 1st time) & there it was. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little pocket camera to take on trips
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for several years. It has been dropped many times and still functions perfectly. It even survived falling into a cup of soda. Great little pocket camera to take on trips. Doesn't have all the fancy features of a more advanced camera, but it does everything needed to get great family adventure pics!
customer_reviews.author: Mari Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: SD1300
customer_reviews.text: The product is good and delivery was very quick. Picture quality is excellent, but as other reviewers noted there is some manual entries that have to be made for certain conditions - the auto feature is not as good as I would like. I miss the viewfinder, but knew it wouldn't be part of this product. It's so small I almost forget it is in my pocket when out and about - makes it very easy to take along any time.
customer_reviews.author: Christphr Knaggs

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For a point and shoot, this is a great camera. Very crisp pictures; even when zoomed to the max. Easy to operate. Battery life seems to be quite acceptable. Nice sized LCD screen. Nice small size and weight. Even in a carrying case, it easily slips into a pocket. Would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Ronn

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is light and makes great basic pictures. A very good point and shoot. I enjoy the ability to also record short clips. Nice colors. Not excellent in low lighting conditions, but better than expected for its class.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: A Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking pictures with this camera ever since I got it to get a "feel" for it. I really can't come up with something negative to say about it! I took motion pictures at a baseball game; shots inside and outside, and all came out very well. I love the size as it is easy to carry in my purse. The instructions that came with it were very clear. I have had several Canon cameras and they do not disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Great While it Lasted
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a gift for my kid. She didn't use it that much and kept it in its case when not in use. After less than a year, the camera wouldn't power up. Purchased replacement battery but didn't help. Have always purchased Canon cameras but this one turned out to be a big disappointment. :(
customer_reviews.author: FortuneRed

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Took plenty of fantastic photos with it. Has enough manuel functions to satisfy an hobbie photographer but not difficult to use for a novice.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better point and shoot cameras. Great price for a versatile small camera. Great backup to my canon Sx20is. I have had good luck with this camera. Picture quality is as good as my SX20is. I do miss the view finder I have on the bigger camera. You can't go wrong with a canon camera.
customer_reviews.author: Harold A. Bouton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for the picture quality that it takes. I just wish that the camera came with the Canon leather hand bag that it recomends on the canon website. Just look at it because it fits well and you will not regret buying something cheap quality for about the same price after shipping costs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot for the price. I've had 3 of this model over the years and every time I destroy it, I always ending up getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Margo Long

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot I've had
customer_reviews.text: After spending weeks looking at all the point and shoots on Amazon and other websites, I finally settled on this one, mostly because I was missing vital months of my son's life. I feel I made a good buy. It works better than any other Canon I've had in the past. And the shutter speed is pretty good for a little point and shoot. Sure, I miss moments with my son, but the only way to seemingly avoid that, is to spend over $600 on a Digital SLR. So for the price, this camera is fine for capturing moments of the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: redtigermom

customer_reviews.title: Great camera while it worked (6 months)
customer_reviews.text: This camera lasted about half a year before the lens stopped telescoping out of the frame. Great camera while it worked, which was not very long.
customer_reviews.author: GEH

customer_reviews.title: Nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: I received this for Christmas. Took some very nice pictures and videos in low light and like the results so far. Nothing major to complain about. I also have a DSLR (high quality) and so I will mainly use this as a back up. I like that it fits nicely in all my purses (even the small ones).
customer_reviews.author: A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a worthy upgrade over my 2006 Canon pocket camera. What impresses me most about the camera is the smart software that it uses when taking pictures. Photos look noticeably more crisp than my last camera. My only minor complaint is that I sometimes accidentally turn the camera on while it is in my pocket. Thankfully the lens is a good sport and hasn't broken so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gem

customer_reviews.title: OK camera
customer_reviews.text: I had the SD1200 for six months before it was lost and replaced with this model. I bought this because of the low light capabilities. The SD 1200 zoom was much easier to use as it was on the back of the button and one could use one's thumb to manuveur it. This model has the zoom onthe front and is not as convenient. Also, the image before shooting the picture is not as clear so I never really know if my subject is in focus. I think this problem is attributable to the larger screen. I am only sure of the clariy when reviewing the shot. All in all, I prefer the SD1200 model.
customer_reviews.author: ladysculler

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera for our 8 year old son for a Christmas present. He was able to take great pictures with it right out of the box! (We'd charged it ahead of time.) He captured some wonderful photos of our Christmas morning with it. He was able to figure the camera out on his own and has thoroughly enjoyed it. The quality of the photos is wonderful. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking to buy a decent camera at this price point!
customer_reviews.author: G. Horner

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had my camera for about a month. Still haven't mastered it but so far most of the pictures I've taken are great. They are clear and crisp...I have to admit the blurry ones are mainly due to user error. The speed between shots is fantastic, which is great for taking sequential shots. I have to say I love this camera :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I bought two and I I already had one
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I already had an SD1200. I use these cameras for work. Nothing beats the usability of the Canon interface in my opinion. I've had 4 Canon cameras in the last three years - the last three have been the SD1200 and 2 SD1300's. All three of the last cameras are still working. I love how easy it goes in and out of my pocket and how fast in focuses and takes the pic when the button is pushed. It slows down quite a bit after a few dozen pics with the flash on but that's understandable - it just takes time to charge the flash. In short, I love the Canon SD's.
customer_reviews.author: AlecWS

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I was bummed when I broke my old Canon Camera, but happy to have this new one. Canon has the best point and shoot camera's. This one takes great pictures, is small and compact and simple to use. It takes great pictures. I bought it a month ago and have already used it on two different weekend vacations. People have pointed out how nice the shots turned out.
customer_reviews.author: JCK

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good photographs considering how low the price of this camera is. No manual control, but again, no one expects full control on entry-level P&S. Ideal for taking photographs on the go, fast, the camera is very small and performs well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Jekic

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverIt's all about the power of contrast. Color that defies convention. Sleek, gentle curves that merge art and technology into a camera designed to inspire. The PowerShot SD1300 IS Digital ELPH camera captures your world as much as it expresses your originality, with bold innovations that include remarkable low light performance. Everything looks right. Hold it, and everything feels right, too.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 It's all about the power of contrast. Color that defies convention. Sleek, gentle curves that merge art and technology into a camera designed to inspire. The PowerShot SD1300 IS Digital ELPH camera captures your world as much as it expresses your originality, with bold innovations that include remarkable low light performance. Everything looks right. Hold it, and everything feels right, too. 

PowerShot SD1300IS Highlights 

28mm wide-angle lens, 4x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer
The Canon commitment to innovation defines the excitement of the PowerShot SD1300 IS Digital ELPH with its 28mm wide-angle lens and 4x optical zoom that makes it easy to get the inspiring, emotive close-ups that will make your images lasting keepsakes. 



This magnificent lens gives you the power to shoot distant subjects with razor-sharp precision and stunning life-like color. So you can brilliantly capture a closer shot of a landscape, or a child's big smile. 

The PowerShot SD1300 IS Digital ELPH is equipped with the acclaimed Canon Optical Image Stabilizer, which automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you'll be proud to shoot and share. And the Canon Optical Image Stabilizer technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 


Smart AUTO mode intelligently selects from 18 settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture-taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you're photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you're getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 15 Shooting Modes, you're ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

12.1-megapixel resolution makes it a breeze to print large size images
With the PowerShot SD1300 IS, dramatic, personal pictures have never been easier to shoot and share. This 12.1-megapixel camera lets you create impressive, large photos of family and friends you'll be proud display. The high-resolution images taken by the PowerShot SD1300 IS can be enlarged up to 13 x 19 inches. 

Bright, clear 2.7-inch PureColor System LCD
The PowerShot SD1300 IS gives you a large 2.7-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. The Canon PureColor System LCD offers spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle. The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, anti-reflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light--a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

Shoot in Low Light mode for dimly-lit situations
With an ISO of 400-6400, the Low Light mode takes the Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS boldly into the shadows! Now even scenes notorious for having insufficient light, such as those lit by candles, fire, or street lamp, come through in fantastic color and clarity, with less noise. You can keep the feel of the scene intact without adding additional light, so the result will be scenes with the visual accuracy, depth and clarity you expect from a Canon camera. 

What's in the Box  * PowerShot SD1300 IS Digital ELPH Body 
 * Lithium-ion Battery Pack NB-6L 
 * Battery Charger CB-2LY 
 * Wrist Strap WS-DC7 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400
